pullRequest.title: Publish Shard State Metrics

nodes.bodyText: Because the writer only emits the node local metrics, the node name is implicit. This is the reason we don't have it here. When we gather the metrics from all the nodes, it can be added. Because it is the same for all the metrics, we don't want to store it as it will save us bytes on the disk (as not having the SQLIte column) and bytes on the heap when we read the table into memory.

Although we are pretty bad at it as you can see from here :) , but in case it is possible, we try to follow this convention -
<ResourceName(capitalized camel case)>_<stat name in Capitalized camel case>. SO for example, Shard_State_Unassigned->Shard_StateUnassigned`.
It might be good to add a javadoc comment with a sample metric emitted in the writer files.
We will consume a lot of bytes on heap if we keep 4 snapshots around. Maybe 2 is good enough.
I am thinking if we can save on bytes by only accounting for unassigned and initializing shards (leaving out the active shards). What remains are the active shards and the happy case.
We can add a doc comment stating how a sample line looks like, what values we are expecting and so on ?
I am thinking, maybe we can statically load this as it is all constants ?
nit: new line in the end ?
Given a shard can only be in one of the three states, can we use a key like shard_state and the value can be the state it is in ?
can we change this to a metric ?
+1, it would be good to have a "timetook" metric to indicate the time taken for metric collection.

Can we add some documentation here? For example CacheConfigDimension : /* * column names of Cache_MaxSize table * cache type | sum | avg | max | min | * *

Example: * Field Data Cache|26214400.0|26214400.0|26214400.0|26214400.0 * Shard Request Cache|80181985.0|80181985.0|80181985.0|80181985.0 */
I am wondering if a better place for these constants will be an enum within AllMetrics.java
Indentation looks off from line 344

nodes.bodyText:
dims can be made a static variable rather than initializing an array list on each emitShardStateMetric execution.
Refer this
Trying to understand why this is relevant or required. The shard states as I understand are enum/string values and we are trying to find an sum/avg/min/max over this string values ?
Let's add a metric here.

nodes.bodyText: unused variable ?
nit: Move ShardStateMetricsSnapshot> shardStateEventMetricsMap) to next line.

The function arguments startTime and endTime arent used anywhere in the function. We can do 2 things here:

Add a new method public void initializeProcessing() within EventProcessor
Initialize startTime and endTime  within this function.

Let's go with 2 for now.
